title: Rivalry series returns for Pisgah-Tuscola
text:
Rivalry series returns for Pisgah-Tuscola Christmas comes twice a year in Haywood County. Post to Facebook Rivalry series returns for Pisgah-Tuscola Christmas comes twice a year in Haywood County. Check out this story on citizen-times.com: http://avlne.ws/1LqQRsU Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Rivalry series returns for Pisgah-Tuscola Andrew Pearson , apearson@citizen-times.com 12:22 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 
Pisgah and Tuscola players were presented with scholar-athlete awards from the Great American Rivalry Series in 2014. (Photo: COURTESY PHOTO) 
Christmas comes twice a year in Haywood County. 
Residents observe Dec. 25 just like everyone else and show up in droves whenever Pisgah and Tuscola play football. 
The Black Bears (4-3, 1-2) and Mountaineers (5-2, 2-1) meet for the 52nd time Friday in Waynesville. Kickoff is set for 7:30 p.m. from Weatherby Stadium. 
For the seventh consecutive year, the Great American Rivalry Series will be returning for the Haywood County game. That means that there will be scholarship opportunities for both schools and a trophy goes to the winner. 
The Mountaineers lead this all-time series, 26-24-1. 
Pisgah-Tuscola is up against 11 other nationwide games in an online voting contest to decide the Great American Rivalry Series' game of the week. Votes may be cast at this link .
